reviews.text: Finally got a chance to check The Pickled Onion in Beverly out on Sunday evening. It is very much a younger (20something) crowd and everyone seemed to know each other. Lots of big screens showing different games. Pool table and 'hoops' machine. I can't remember our server's name but she was fantastic. Friendly, quick service with a smile. I have to say I was happily surprised to see Poutine on the menu....I promptly ordered it. Poutine is IMO the perfect snack when you are drinking. Fries or tots(!) Covered in delicious beef gravy with melted cheese on top. These were some,of the best I've had. The martinis were very good too. My only issue here is that all of their seats are hard wooden barstools. Def NOT handicapped friendly, otherwise I'm happy we tried it!

Some of the bar tending staff are rude, impatient and unnecessary judgemental. I’m not one to get offended easily but it’s just uncalled for .. especially from someone who wants a tip ????

Weird nosed bouncer is obnoxious too

Ignoring the employees, I always have a great time here with friends and meeting new people
Great bar! Service with a smile! Very good beer selection. Private parking lot opposite street side 200 feet up towards lights. Large bar or table seating. Bartender very helpful with beer selection.
Everything time we visit the staff is very nice and welcoming. Good environment for a drink.

Was there waiting for a friend to join me at a table and for 45 minutes not one soul that works there came up to me. I used to go there every weekend. Neither my friends or myself will go there again. Not to worry though, they have plenty of other customer's to loose.
